alert.note: Alert for Northeastern Brooks Range (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 27 at 2:56PM AKST until January 29 at 6:00AM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM AKST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Cold wind chills to 55 below and blowing snow occurring. Visibility will be one half mile or less at times. The cold wind chills will cause frostbite in as little as 10 minutes to exposed skin. * WHERE...In Brooks Range Passes * WHEN...Until 6 AM Saturday. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...North winds gusting to 25 mph will cause very cold wind chills and blowing and drifting snow in passes. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... A Winter Weather Advisory for blowing snow means that visibilities will be limited due to strong winds blowing snow around. Use caution when traveling, especially in open areas. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
